column4: Does anybody have any idea how to reverse the effects of compiz --replace -c emerald &?
just a guess: metacity --replace ?
fr500: Thank you both very much. That worked perfectly. You guys are all so knowledgeable and helpful!
np.  :)
that probably means that emerald is crashing... though i don't know why it would.
uh.. then the gtk-window-decorator...
or whatever.  I'm not a big compiz person.
One last time, what is the command?
do 'metacity --replace' to fix things
then open up a terminal, and type 'compiz --replace' there.
Er... the thing i sent to me was supposed to go to you  hopefully something useful will show up in the terminal.
did 'compiz --replace' from a terminal show any output?
My screen flashed, nothing changed. No output in the terminal window.
hm.  odd.  compiz always puts something in the terminal for me.  no clue then.
They might be in /var/cache/apt
Thanks. I'm only wondering because I was trying to decide whether to keep an inventory folder of all my pkgs.
you can check what's on your system with a 'sudo updatedb' followed by 'locate -r '.*\.deb$'
why would you want to do that?
I don't know. I have a tendancy to save installers on Windows, and was wondering if I should on Ubuntu.
I see no reason.  the repositories aren't going anywhere, if you need to install... and the uninstall info isn't stored with the .deb
Thanks for the advice. I won't be doing that now.
